outputs.output_descr: The project aims at reducing threats to public health through clearance and safe disposal of UXOs, removing accumulated rubbles and improving solid waste collection in the Gaza Strip. Palestinian people's livelihood in the Gaza Strip and their access to essential services were severely impacted as a result of the Israeli bombardment and military operations during the period December 2008-January 2009. A total of 600,000 tons of rubble was generated and more than 25,000 tons of municipal solid waste accumulated at random dump sites closed to residential areas which pose serious threats to the public health. The overall situation of solid waste management in the Gaza Strip is weak due to weakened local authorities as a result of lack of financial and technical capacity and inadequate infrastructure for proper collection, treatment and disposal of municipal solid waste. The project will generate more than 400,000 working days opportunities to residents of the affected areas, improving farmers accessibility ; collection of solid waste and promotion of composting and recycling.

donor_name: SWISS AGENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND  COOPERATION OFFICE NEPAL
outputs.output_descr: This project aims to support advanced UN early recovery coordination and interagency programming, for comprehensive and multi-stakeholder early recovery through focused monitoring of socio-economic and human development impact of the crisis, early recovery analysis, coordination and setting the stage for early recovery through joint programming. This two-year initiative shall set the stage for a comprehensive early recovery multi-stakeholder response, with impact on all areas of the Gaza Strip. This proposal will be incorporated into the existing project "Rapid Support to Livelihoods and Social Services in Gaza and Advanced Planning for Early Recovery", as a revision / expansion of its Output 4.

The project's aim is to enhance the resilience of the Gaza Strip residents through supporting agro- productivity and livelihoods based interventions, rehabilitation of destroyed agriculture facilities, in addition to enhance access to basic services through rehabilitation of damaged electricity networks and enhancing the delivery of power supply in the Gaza Strip. The project comes as a response to the urgent needs of the Palestinian population following the late Israeli military action in 2009 on the Gaza Strip. The military assault inflicted large scale of damages on the infrastructure including agriculture and electricity facilities.  The project was deigned to immediately restore damaged agriculture and electricity facilities through the procurement and installation of new equipment and spare parts. 
As for the electricity intervention, the objective of the urgent support to energy sector is to increase the amount of power evacuation for Gaza Power Generating Plant via the Gaza West Transformers Substation by additional (40 MW) added capacity.   The electricity support intervention composes of the following:
1. Rehabilitation of Gaza Power Generating Plant by supplying and installing two step up and two step down transformers, one complete transformer bay including protection, control, civil works and the recommended spare parts.
2. Supply and install 11  km electricity distribution and transport networks in Gaza city , North and middle of Gaza Strip.
3. 78 KM of rehabilitation and extension of electricity network within the whole Gaza Strip to minimize the losses within the distribution network.

Provide immediate humanitarian relief to internally displaced registered non-refugee Palestinian families whose homes were destroyed in the Gaza Strip through the provision of cash assistance and to strictly compensate Palestinian's in the Gaza Strip for their direct losses as a result of the Israeli military operation which started on 27 December 2008 and lasted until 18 January 2009.

On July, 2009, the United Nations Development Programme / Programme of Assistance to the Palestinian People (UNDP/PAPP) and the Government of Sweden through (SIDA) agency signed an Agreement through which SIDA has entrusted UNDP/PAPP with a grant of SEK 18 Million (Nearly US$ 2,380,331) for the implementation of Gaza UXOs and Rubble Removal project.  

In March 2010, the Government of Sweden has entrusted UNDP for an additional fund of 20 Million SEK (Nearly US$2,687,840) to cover all remaining UXOs and rubble removal activities from all areas in the Gaza Strip. UNDP has submitted new proposal through amendment of on-going agreement between UNDP and SIDA. This amendment covers new rubble removal from Middle, Khanyounis and Rafah area, and then crushing of removed concrete rubble in order to be used in rehabilitation of damaged roads in Gaza Strip. According to the new amendment, two new contracts for rubble removal from Middle and Southern governorates and one contract for road rehabilitation are signed.

the planned outputs of the project are:
1.An amount of 138,000 tons removed rubble deconstructed, sorted and transported.
2.A total of 100,000 tons of concrete rubble is crushed.
3. A total of  25 km of rural roads is rehabilitated by utilizing crushed material and 44,700 square meters of interlock tiles and 5,800 meter installed
4. UXOs are cleared and disposed safely
5.Hazardous materials are separated and disposed in an environmentally sound manner

project_descr: Emergency Supply & Advanced Plan. for Early Recovery-Gaza.  This project aims to support advanced UN ER co.ord. and inter-agency programming, for comprehensive and multi-stakeholders.
project_title: Emergency Supply & Advanced Plan for Early Recovery-Gaza
